radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of the abdomen and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Splenomegaly (spleen length, 15.6 cm); central filling defect in the splenic vein compatible with acute splenic-vein thrombosis.
Low lung volumes; scattered ground-glass opacities; no evidence of pulmonary embolism.
Confluent area of hypodensity and sulcal effacement in the superior right parietal lobe; suggests recent infarct; small focal areas of hyperdensity consistent with hemorrhagic conversion.
Confirmed infarcts and hemorrhagic conversion; a cortical vein not visible over the lesion suggests cortical-vein thrombosis or secondary compression due to mass effect.
Multiple cerebral venous thrombi involving the right frontal and parietal cortical veins; no involvement of the major dural sinuses.
